{"WikiHow Style Article": {"step1": {"Heading": "Preparing the Clams", "content": "1. Place the clams in the freezer for 10-15 minutes to make them easier to open.
2. Take a small knife and position it against the opening of the clam.
3. Apply pressure and close the knife to partially open the clam.
4. Repeat this process for all the clams, opening them partially.
5. If a clam is harder to open, use a towel to grip it and break it open.
6. Clean the inside of the clams using a small spoon or knife."}, "step2": {"Heading": "Opening the Oysters", "content": "1. Use a sturdy oyster knife to go into the hinge of the oyster.
2. Apply pressure and pop the oyster open.
3. Repeat this process for all the oysters, opening them partially.
4. Use a small knife to cut the nerve and make the oyster loose.
5. Clean the inside of the oysters using a small spoon or knife.
6. If you're having trouble opening an oyster, try using pliers or microwaving it for a few seconds."}, "step3": {"Heading": "Making the Horseradish Sauce", "content": "1. In a bowl, combine a quarter cup of ketchup, a teaspoon of hot sauce, and a teaspoon of lemon juice or mild vinegar.
2. Add a tablespoon of horseradish and mix well.
3. This is the classic sauce to serve with the clams and oysters."}, "step4": {"Heading": "Preparing the Mignonette Sauce", "content": "1. Crush black pepper using a skillet or mortar and pestle.
2. Finely chop shallots and chives.
3. In a bowl, combine the crushed black pepper, shallots, chives, a dash of salt, and red wine vinegar.
4. Mix well to create the mignonette sauce.
5. Serve the sauce on top of the oysters."}}, "Summary": "Learn how to open clams and oysters with the help of legendary chef Jacques Pepin.
